intro: Justicia vitzliputzli, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its vibrant red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Justicia vitzliputzli is often used in ornamental gardening for its striking appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
